text: I'd definitely backtest this and separate out competition - I think it likely league football will play out differently to cup/knockout football

text: I actually feel bad about saying anything about this lest I put anyone on a wrong path. Too late to redact. Please either ignore or absolutely backtest. Without data, things are opinions and so I take the betangel forum comment to heart. I am not about to publish a math paper that details out such edges (for competitors and internet strangers to exploit)

text: Has anyone tried running their same strategies on smaller exchanges? E.g. maybe using the same pricing model but just executing on betdaq instead? If so, do you find that your margins are higher (i.e. profit / volume traded)?

elements.text: Has anyone tried running their same strategies on smaller exchanges? E.g. maybe using the same pricing model but just executing on betdaq instead? If so, do you find that your margins are higher (i.e. profit / volume traded)?

text: I had the same issue in Aus in December - hosted a meet up in Sydney and had very few come in, fundamentally because no one is in the city. ironically had a much better attendance in Melbourne, but I think that was because it’s a more easily accessible city (trains/trams etc) and more people live close in, even though no one was in the office at the time.

elements.text: I had the same issue in Aus in December - hosted a meet up in Sydney and had very few come in, fundamentally because no one is in the city. ironically had a much better attendance in Melbourne, but I think that was because it’s a more easily accessible city (trains/trams etc) and more people live close in, even though no one was in the office at the time.
